content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: How many types of Apple Pencil are currently available on the Apple's website? Which one supports Wireless pairing and charging.  Please interact with https://www.apple.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find information about Apple Pencil types and their features, the most relevant section would be under "Accessories" since Apple Pencil is an accessory for iPad. I should click on the "Accessories" menu to proceed.
Action: Click [12]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am in the Accessories section, but I need to find Apple Pencil, which may not be in the iPhone accessory listings shown. The best action is to either scroll down to see more accessory categories or use a "Browse all" or search function to find the Apple Pencil specifically.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find the Apple Pencil, the most appropriate category would likely be "Creative Tools" since the Apple Pencil is used for drawing and creativity on the iPad. I should click on "Creative Tools" to narrow down the accessory search.
Action: Click [28]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I can see three types of Apple Pencil available: Apple Pencil Pro, Apple Pencil (USB-C), and Apple Pencil (2nd generation). To determine which one supports wireless pairing and charging, I need to check more details/specifications, especially for Apple Pencil Pro and 2nd generation, as they both might have wireless features.
Action: Click [27]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I've already selected the Apple Pencil Pro product image, but no product details are currently displayed. To get product specifications (possibly including wireless pairing and charging), I should click for more details or try the next step, as the primary area for text or more information might be a clickable area below the image.
Action: Click [29]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Clicking on the product image did not reveal more information or specifications about the Apple Pencil Pro. The likely location for detailed information or the product page is the text/button area below the product image (which is usually a clickable link to the product details).
Action: Click [29]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screen and element selection have not changed, indicating my previous click on [29] may not have been successful or did not lead to a product details page. Since the clickable area below the other Apple Pencil items (like [32] or [35]) may offer more details, I should try the next product detail area under the Apple Pencil (2nd generation).
Action: Click [35]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The display still shows the same three Apple Pencil products, and clicking the text areas for more information ([29] and [35]) has not worked so far. It’s possible that I need to scroll down to reveal more detailed descriptions or features that may not be currently visible in the screenshot.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot now confirms there are three Apple Pencil models listed: Apple Pencil Pro, Apple Pencil (USB-C), and Apple Pencil (2nd generation). To answer which one supports wireless pairing and charging, I likely need access to the product specifications or a detailed feature comparison page. Clicking the product name may provide detailed information on features for the "Apple Pencil (2nd generation)" since this model is known to have wireless capabilities.
Action: Click [21]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Apple Pencil (2nd generation) product page is shown, but there are no details about wireless charging or pairing visible. I need to scroll down to find more specifications or key features that mention wireless connectivity and charging.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.9

content:
Thought: The "Overview" section of the Apple Pencil (2nd generation) states that it "pairs, charges, and stores magnetically on the side of your iPad." This confirms it supports wireless pairing and charging. I have now observed there are three Apple Pencil types (Pro, USB-C, and 2nd gen.), and the 2nd generation supports wireless pairing and charging.
Action: ANSWER; There are currently three types of Apple Pencil available on Apple's website: Apple Pencil Pro, Apple Pencil (USB-C), and Apple Pencil (2nd generation). The Apple Pencil (2nd generation) supports wireless pairing and charging.
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 1.0
